metadata.name: The Abstract Truth I  #286
metadata.description:
Moiré patterns meet halftone dots meet cross stitching.

Halftone is a term that can refer to both a technology used in image processing and as the synonym for semitone in music. A jazz musician Oliver Nelson released the album The Blues and the Abstract Truth in 1961. It is considered one of the most significant records of its time. In addition, he wrote Patterns for Improvisation, a hugely popular jazz patterns book. The Moiré pattern design is on the book's cover.

Look out for the FOMO keyboard key to unlock more variations. 
Press 'P' to pause/unpause the animation.

metadata.name: Imperfect Portals #2
metadata.description:
Imperfect Portals
This is the final and closing part of the series telling the story of Portals.
Imperfect portals are just like our memories, over time memories lose their sharpness and some even lose their shape and in some cases take a completely new form, sometimes they may only have small pieces or spots of color left, but they still remain with us try not to lose them completely.

15 colors
Also with some coincidence the shape of a circle can appear, thank you and good luck to you.

By aleks.ustya, @ALEKUSTN. Made with p5js.

metadata.name: Tork #212
metadata.description:
Tork is a generative artwork that invites you into a frenzied, distorted space where order collapses in on itself and clarity slips away.

What started as an exploration into recursive grid subdivision quickly evolved as our good friend Entropy invited itself in and I couldn't resist the temptation to let it take control.

Created to celebrate the 'fxhash turns one' anniversary mint event. #fxhashturnsone

----------

Interaction:

* Press 's' in the Live Mode to save as PNG
* Watch the drawing unfold by adding '&build=1' to the URL in Live Mode
* Change the size by adding '&size=1' to the URL in Live Mode [1=1000, 2=2000, 3=4000, 4=8000]

Features:

* A broad set of colour palettes, subtle and not-so-subtle variations in paint modes, and dramatic layer distortions to discover.

Licensed under CC BY 4.0
https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/

@concept_blend - 2022

metadata.name: The muon in the hole #2
metadata.description:
Special collection for #fxhashturnsone.

Halftones, dynamic composition and contrasts.

Procedural realtime javascript / webgl.
Desktop / Chrome recommended.


Controls :
- Mouse wheel/middle/ Pinch : Zoom
- After zooming, Mouse left / Drag : Pan
- Press [r] to reset the camera.
- Press [f] to toggle the frame.
- Press [c] to fully unlock the camera, with rotation on Mouse2.
- Export a PNG capture at various resolutions by pressing the number keys [1] to [9] (top row or numpad, and only in live mode, after pressing "open"). Resolutions ranges from 720 to 7680 pixels for the smallest dimension. I recommend starting with [4] and going from there. What is captured is what's on screen, so you can get creative if you so desire.

NFT License

metadata.name: "Oneirism" #77
metadata.description:
Oneirism is a state of abnormal consciousness in which dream-like experiences and hallucinations happen while awake.
This describes the situation I went through learning and writing the algorithm for my first generative project (100 % code)
By learning p5js i discovered a new side of my artistic self and a path i want to follow to make art and express my feelings.
Thanks everyone from my bottom of my heart for helping and guiding me on those difficult last months.

--Features--

Palette : 16 different color schemes
Build : 2 Shapes
Step : "Low" "Medium" "High"
Rotation : 7 types (each type has more than 40 different outcomes)
Fading(Rare) : True or False

Press "s" to save a 1600x2000 PNG

Made with p5js.

Gtsiliakos_art, September 2022

metadata.name: Monsoon #53
metadata.description:
Optimization. It's something that haunts all programmers. Including me. But no longer! Monsoon is a study into the optimization of particle systems for the web. Looking especially deep into dynamic grids and dynamic frame rates.

As for the piece itself, it's a reference to how busy this modern world is. How we're all constantly on the go, whether that is physically, or mentally. Almost feeling like a monsoon. A storm of information. A storm of life. A storm of work. A storm of thoughts. A storm of emotions. A storm of everything. And it's all so fast.

As are the particles. They're all moving around these cyclones of information. Glowing up like neon signs in a busy city. Moving so fast it's almost a blur. Forming into something greater than the sum of its parts.

metadata.name: Part:Counterpart #95
metadata.description:
'Part:Counterpart' is an experiment in form, disintegration, and context. Each work is created within one of three modes, Part, Counterpart, or Part:Counterpart.

In experimenting, I've enjoyed taking a simple composition and breaking it down with various methods. This transforms the original composition into something new, but it also begins to lose what the original had to say. This isn't necessarily a bad thing, and I want to dive a little deeper and explore ideas as a sort of tangible substance. Already we're comparing ideas against their translations and evolutions, but what happens if we present them both within the context of the other?

Additionally, what if we present both of these ideas with echoes and tangents, discussion around the ideas and their practical applications instead of imagined? Sure, these aren't our idea, or even our translation, but they exist only because the originals do.

How does this change our opinion of the original? Is every idea destined to be picked apart and reimagined forever until it bears only a faint resemblance? Where is the line between our Counterpart and an echo?

This piece hopes to inspire contemplation on the nature of storytelling and artistic inspiration.

10% of ideas are encrypted to obscure the original Part.
Press ’s’ to save a 3600x4500 png.
Press ‘p’ to save the original Part, pure and untouched.

metadata.name: ∞ Movement and Time ∞ #11
metadata.description:
Every living organism has an inner filling, such as the physical and the material. In front of you is a path of geometric shapes filled with particles that will die in the future, like all living things, but each has left its mark on this canvas to create a story for you!

WARNING!!! I warn you it takes a long time to load the canvas. (5-30sec)



Save "image" - open the window and tap key "S"

Created with p5js



And I want to thank everyone for their help, special thanks to Oleg Abakshonok.

metadata.name: Symbology437 #68
metadata.description:
Abstract, distorted compositions using symbols from the original IBM VGA codepage 437 character set. The symbols were created in code as bitmaps, scaled, and then drawn onto the canvas. The shading is based on the characters and sets from ANSI and ASCII art styles. 

There are 4 main types of outputs:
- Abstracts, 50%
- Random characters, 25%
- One of 16 preset character layouts, 25%
- One of 16 custom symbol PFP styles that will be 10% of the total outputs

For abstracts, there are several main styles created from layering different base shapes: circles, filled circles, rectangles, flow field lines, and rain-like streaks.

Color combinations include monochromatic, green or amber, dark mode, and multicolor.

Press 's' to save the image. The size is 2318x3000px, and for PFPs, the size is 3000x3000px.

Copyright (c) 2022 Matt Perkins, hello@mattperkins.me, @nudoru on Twitter. Licensed under CC BY-NC-SA 4.0, see LICENSE.txt for more information.

metadata.name: Hatchet: Uzumaki #21
metadata.description:
Hatchet: Uzumaki (渦巻) is the first piece in Hatchet; a generative art series that hatches an arrangement of segmented polygons generated via a Voronoi diagram. Uzumaki (Japanese for 'spiral') arranges it's polygons in a multi-armed spiral with varying arm lengths and twist intensities.

All pieces in Hatchet are composed to emulate the aesthetic of colored pencils on paper. Each piece is capable of exporting its hatch lines as a well-labeled SVG document. This will allow collectors interested in plotting to create physical renditions of their iteration.

The following key-press actions are supported on the token:
- 'r': Animate the erasure and re-drawing of the hatch lines.
- 's': Export the SVG document describing the arrangement of hatch lines.

metadata.name: Maginaria #94
metadata.description:
8 custom palettes with color variations.
1 normal composition and 5 variations.

made by @mdollinger with p5js
twitter: @dollingermauro

Press “T” to save a lossless tiff file
Press “S” to save a png file

libraries: p5js, canvas-to-tiff

metadata.name: In the Edge #438
metadata.description:
./ In the Edge

It's been a long time since your journey began, caring for the ones you love, pursuing your dreams, and giving the best of you. 

Now you know you can't go back, you can't go further, you know your time is coming.

How far did you go? It doesn't matter, you did it right. Your accomplishments will serve well the next generations in their journeys, in their search for themselves.

Now it's time to stop, time to take a moment and contemplate the vast universe.

Soon all of this will be ending.

You did it right.

Embrace the void.
=========
=========


./ Color scheme (feature)
There are 12 color schemes and with each set, specific arrays for color collections for the space, stars, planet, and accent colors. 

These are color schemes in the known universe of "In the Edge":
- Mars visions
- Cyberpunk
- Unknown passenger 
- Renegade
- Primary
- Coral
- r.e.d.
- Machines of an ancient-future 
- The void
- Tinted light 
- Malibu dreams
- Atari (horrendous brown, red and yellowish combinations... I love it)

./ Mountain type (feature)
In the Edge, you will find a mountain, and that mountain will be special, which type will you find?

- Parallela insolitum
- Sandy dunes of the truth
- Wavy uncertainty
- Intrinsic soul ridges
- Cerritulus formationis

./ Mountain direction (feature)
Life is about direction... mountains too.

- Left
- Right
- Left-Right

./ Space scenery
This is the spicy touch, some of the iterations will have animation and others will not, giving you a clear view of the magnificent space in front of you.

- Clean (NOT animated)
- Windy planet (animated)
- Topographic planet (animated)
- Meteor shower (animated)

./ Distance from Earth (feature)
How far did you go? Your travel could be from 1 lightyear to 999,999,999 lightyears (that's a lot of lights and years!). However just a few will pass the barrier of 99,999,999ly.

// Additional perks
./ Planet names 
Planet names are unique and they are conformed by three blocks.

The first block is a conjunction between ancient Latin names and Japanese last names. 

The second block takes the last three characters from the fxhash.

The third block takes three numbers from the number seed obtained from fxrand().

The planet you land will be unique, as unique as you are.

// Controls
./ Pause-Play animation
Because maybe (and just maybe) you want to freeze the perfect moment before closing your eyes.

[Backspace] Pause.
[Enter] Play

Applies to "Space scenery" features windy planet, topographic planet, and meteor shower.

metadata.name: Cube #13
metadata.description: A tribute to Edward Zajec’s iconic “Il Cubo” from 1971.

metadata.name: Primitifs systématiques #141
metadata.description:
Primitifs systématiques is the first generative instalment of David Umemoto’s studies of space and volume. Placed at the crux of brutalism and minimalism, these structures based on the original stackable concrete piece Primitif 04 evoke impossible paths yet to be explored. 

The original Primitif 04 has been both preserved and dented, conserved and enhanced. It is still here. But it cannot be found, only encountered. Throughout your explorations of the Primitifs systématiques, you will find that its original shapes have been multiplied, rotated, re-ordered to create new structures. After spending some time exploring its paths, when you stop looking for it, you will realize that 04 is still here, intact.

Lines of work chosen for this piece also draw a perspective. The orientation of the primitives pulls directly towards an intense source of light. Sometimes it is visible, sometimes it is not. This perfect alignment is a call to life. They who look at the sunrise with relief cannot be anything but hopeful. But how can we project life on a concrete behemoth? Stand long enough in front of it, and you too will see that we have no choice but to.

----

Primitifs systématiques is the generative art genesis piece of David Umemoto. It was built in collaboration with Anaglyphic. It is the first collaborative spatial token made available on the anaver.se.
